title: Reaction with most positive cell potential

content.question: Reduction Half-Reaction <math alttext="E naught, in volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi><mo>°</mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> <math alttext="A g with a positive 1 charge, plus one electron, react to produce A g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Ag</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>→</mo><mi>Ag</mi></math> <math alttext="0.80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.80</mn></math> <math alttext="S n with a positive 2 charge, plus 2 electrons, react to produce S n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Sn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>→</mo><mi>Sn</mi></math> <math alttext="negative 0.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>0.14</mn></mpadded></math> <math alttext="F e with a positive 2 charge, plus 2 electrons, react to produce F e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Fe</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>→</mo><mi>Fe</mi></math> <math alttext="negative 0.44" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>0.44</mn></math> <math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge, plus 2 electrons, react to produce Z n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Zn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>→</mo><mi>Zn</mi></math> <math alttext="negative 0.76" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>0.76</mn></math> The standard reduction potentials of some half-reactions are given in the table above. Of the following equations, which represents the reaction that would be the basis of a cell with the most positive <math alttext="E naught sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mi>E</mi><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow><mo>°</mo></msubsup></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 A g with a positive 1 charge, plus S n, react to produce 2 A g, plus S n with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>Ag</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>Sn</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>Ag</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>Sn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math alttext="S n with a positive 2 charge, plus 2 A g, react to produce S n, plus 2 A g with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Sn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>Ag</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>Sn</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>Ag</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math>

<math alttext="F e with a positive 2 charge, plus Z n, react to produce F e, plus Z n with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Fe</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>Zn</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>Fe</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>Zn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge, plus F e, react to produce Z n, plus F e with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Zn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>Fe</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>Zn</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>Fe</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 A g with a positive 1 charge, plus S n, react to produce 2 A g, plus S n with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>Ag</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>Sn</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>Ag</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>Sn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
